utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I’ve got terrible news.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Before I tell you, perhaps I should soften the blow. You’re face is pleasingly symmetrical.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just tell me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A Swedish team of physicists is trying to scoop our super-fluid vortex experiment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, well, that kind of stinks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That kind of stinks? Why aren’t you more upset? Did I soften the blow too much? Because this here is more like a Picasso painting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are we going to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perform the experiment immediately.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d love to, but we need liquid helium and our shipment’s on back order for a month.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A month? What? Are you kidding me? That would have been a good time for you to soften the blow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That shirt brings out the blue in your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Aren’t you sweet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s go check to see if the university has any helium in reserve.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you know that I almost didn’t wear this shirt today?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Barry, we’re in trouble. We need liquid helium, does the department have any we can use?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Sowwy, there’s a showtage. And what we do have I need for my quantum excitation study.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But you won’t need much for that.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Twue, but if it’s successful, I’m having a pawty with bawwoons.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, Barry, there’s a Swedish team trying to run our experiment before us. Can’t you spare any?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Be honest, if the shoe was on the other foot, would you do this for me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He said be honest, so I was honest. Didn’t your mother tell you? It’s the best policy. So, what do you say?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Hell no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He could’ve softened the blow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why do you need Kripke? Can’t you just go to Party City for helium?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’d have to go to every Party City in California.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sounds like you on Cinco de Mayo.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, people were still talking about that party on siete de Mayo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, if that Swedish team beats us, I will never be able to enjoy anything from their country again. Which is a shame, because Swedish meatballs are my favourite toothpick-delivered meatball.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you need liquid helium so bad, I know a guy who can get you some, if you don’t ask too many questions.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who is he?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where does he work?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How does he get the helium?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How many questions are too many questions?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe he’s not for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Four questions. There answer’s four.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, you know who went out on a date the other night? Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, good for him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I thought so, too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So is she, like, homeless, or framing him for a crime?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s using some kind of dating app on his phone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, which one? Maybe we can get Amy to try it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know. Stuart, can you come in here? He tried to explain it to me. It shows you pictures of people nearby, you swipe them around, it looks kind of like a game.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, and if you lose the game, you have to go out with Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can you show us that dating app?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure. This thing has changed my life.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. So how many girls have you met?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Two. I probably don’t need to mention there’s an entire number between that and zero.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, so how does it work?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, well, it, it shows me all the single women in a five-mile radius who are using the app. If I like the way they look I hit thumbs up, if I don’t, thumbs down.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, what would make you give a girl a thumbs down?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: First time it happens I will let you know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey. I just heard back from the liquid helium guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s he say?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s got what we need and can meet us tonight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? You know I don’t like buying things at night. January 7th, 2009, I went to the Ralph’s at 11:30pm to pick up Cracklin’ Oat Bran for the morning and what did I see?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The man restocking the cereal shelves.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s right. And what did he do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He handed you the box directly and called you Stretch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s like it was yesterday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you want liquid helium or not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course I do. I don’t want that Swedish team scooping us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then I’m going to tell him we’re in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, wait. This is highly unethical.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re just bending the rules a little. We have grant money to do the experiment, so we’re going to spend it on the helium we need. It’s not like when Dr. Goldfarb claimed he bought an electron microscope and he was really just keeping a Russian girl in an apartment in Van Nuys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Was she helping him with his research?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. So, are we doing this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, but where does he get the helium?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Remember? Don’t ask too many questions?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, but this is violating university code.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A little, but if I may quote Einstein, the pursuit of science calls us to ignore the rules set by man.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Huh. All right, do it. Tell him we’re in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t find that quote on the Internet. Did you make that up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Before I answer, may I just say your skin has never looked better.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aren’t you just made of sugar.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not sure how I feel about this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, just let him put the app on your phone.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, Stuart got two dates with it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: One of which would’ve ended in sex had she not said no. Okay, all set.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, let me see. Nope, nope, nope, oh, he’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Doesn’t a teardrop tattoo mean he murdered someone?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And he’s sad about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, I thought you were gonna be out late?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you wanted me to stay out later, you should’ve given me more spending money.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you guys up to?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We put Amy on a dating app, and we’re seeing what’s out there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, fun. Let me see. Uh, no, no, uh, definitely not.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What was wrong with that guy?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, he’s Indian. We’ve already got one of those. Ooh, we should find a nice Latino, really round us out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I want to try.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, can I have my phone back?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, I’m trying to find you the next great love of your life. The man who will father your children. Okay, yes or no on white guy with dreadlocks?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That must be him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course. An nondescript, white panel van. You may be familiar with it from the sentence, their bodies were found in a nondescript, white panel van.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I’m Leonard. This is my friend…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m Skippy. Skippy Cavanaugh.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Great. You got the cash?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, uh, right here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, hold on, hold on. How do we know that you’re not gonna take the money and drive away?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What ya doing, Skippy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Exactly what 1970s television crime dramas have taught us. You give us the helium first.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, how do I know you’re not gonna drive away without paying me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Guess I’m not the only one who watches ’70s television crime dramas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, you can trust us. We’re respected scientists.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, he is. I’m a wedding planner who can’t find love himself. It’s ironic, but the point is we can’t trust you. You’re a sketchy character in a parking garage.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, well, from my perspective, that’s how you two appear to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I never thought of it like that. Boy, frame of reference will just sneak up on you, won’t it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My friend does make a decent point about the money. I don’t feel comfortable just handing it over up front.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Ah, no money, no helium. Seems we’re at a, uh, stalemate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not technically. In chess, a stalemate refers to a situation in which there are no remaining moves. Uh, you have plenty of moves available. You could beat us up and steal the money. You could kill us, you know. Really, you’re only limited by your imagination.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Huh. All these years I’ve been using stalemate, when I really mean impasse. I feel foolish.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think it matters if this is a stalemate or an impasse or a Mexican standoff. What are we gonna do here?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, whoa, whoa, how can it bea Mexican standoff? Everybody knows you need three sides for that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not necessarily. Uh, many argue the essence of a Mexican standoff is that no one can walk away from the conflict without incurring harm.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hmm, I don’t follow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let me give you an example. Earlier today, I decoded the headers on your e-mail, and I know that your name is Kenneth Fitzgerald. From that, I figured out where you live and where you work. Now, to make this a Mexican standoff, I would say something like, uh, you give us the helium or I’ll turn you in to the authorities.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Is that a threat?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, exactly. See, you’re getting it.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I know where you work, all right? And if you mess with me, I’ll report you, then I’ll pound your asses into the ground.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perfect. Now we really are in a Mexican standoff. Is this one of those times where I’ve won the battle but lost the war?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Afraid so, Skippy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I told you we shouldn’t go shopping at night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, let’s all just calm down. Nobody wants to report anybody.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: No, I don’t like this. I’m out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no. Wait, don’t go. Just let me explain. We’re physicists, and we’re trying to prove a hypothesis that we’ve been working on for over a year.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Really? What’s the hypothesis?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Space-time can be interpreted as the surface of an n-dimensional superfluid.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hmm. Could be, could be. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, but now there’s this Swedish team that read our paper and they’re trying to beat us to our own discovery. We really need this helium.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I’m sorry I lied about being a wedding planner who can’t find love. Although I am currently single, if you know anybody.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here’s the money. Can we do this?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Okay. It’s a shame about those scientists ripping you off. I expected a higher ethical standard from our friends in Sweden.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s actually pretty common in our field. There’s not much you can do about it.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Well, for the right amount of money, if you know where they live, there’s, uh, plenty we could do about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you hear that, Leonard? There’s plenty we could do about it. Do you have a card?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, here we go. Now everyone can see. All right. Where do we stand on cross-eyed Mike?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know he won’t be looking at other girls.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Unless they’re sitting on the end of his nose.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, okay, okay. Thumbs down. Next.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ew, check out his tiny teeth. He looks like a man-dolphin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well if he’s good in bed, she can throw him a fish.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I love you, Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, I’m starting to feel guilty. Aren’t we being a little mean?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s a fair point. We wouldn’t make fun of someone like this to their face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, it’s Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You may want to leave the room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right this way, Uncle Harvey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you stop with that already?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m trying not to attract attention.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And tipping his hat to the cleaning lady didn’t do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She said buenas noches. What was he supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s just start the experiment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, we should probably have our story straight in case we get caught.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not getting caught.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you can’t be sure of that. What if the helium dealer rats us out? What if Kripke asks where we got it? What if the university checks my family tree and finds out I don’t have an Uncle Harvey?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The dealer doesn’t care, Kripke has no authority over us, and you being related to a metal container would explain a lot. Help me hook this up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, did you see this sticker?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s partially torn off, but the segment that remains reads property of and the letter U.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s probably USC or UCLA.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but what if it’s Property of U.S. Government? There’s a national helium reserve in Amarillo, Texas. If this was stolen from there, we’re accessories to a federal crime.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s not jump to conclusions. A lot of things start with U.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s true. There’s the U.S. Air Force, U.S. Department of Defence, U.S. Navy, you and I are going to jail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, we can do the experiment as planned and beat the Swedish team to the punch, or we can kiss our dreams good-bye because we were to afraid to break a few rules.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, does everyone remember the rules? If he’s shirtless, one sip. Posing with a pet, two sips. Pet and shirtless, chug like it’s your job. And pull.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I have that same underwear.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Chug.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, you’re getting a text.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, um, give me that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I had a great time last night.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, no, stop reading that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who’s Dave?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You went on a date last night? Are you seeing someone?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it, it’s not like that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And I’d love to take you out again”?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Amy/What?/Can’t believe it/Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, it’s like that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you for coming back.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, well, normally I wouldn’t, but my daughter’s having a sleepover, and there’s only so much screaming and Katy Perry a man can take.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Anyway, if you could just give us our money back, you can have your helium and we’ll be on our way.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, well, is there something wrong with it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, nothing. We just changed our mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He has glasses and I’m a know-it-all, we are not built for prison.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, I hear you. Well, you’re good guys, so I’ll, uh, I’ll take the helium off your hands.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: But you ain’t getting your money back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re taking advantage of us? We clarified nomenclature together.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Look, I enjoy semantic digressions as much as the next guy, but, uh, this is business.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what? It’s fine. Keep the money. We just want to be done with this.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: No problem, but I am gonna have to charge you a small helium restocking fee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He wants more money.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it better not be more than a thousand dollars. That’s all I’ve got on me.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: That’s exactly how much it is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Finally, something breaks our way.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’re seeing someone and we don’t even know about it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, why wouldn’t you tell us?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because it’s new and weird and I’m just trying to figure it all out. And I knew if I told you guys I had been out with a few people that you’d get way too excited about it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: A few people?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So, are we allowed to ask how it’s going?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s going fine. It’s mostly just been meeting people for coffee.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? I thought we were all… never mind.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I, I thought you weren’t ready to start seeing people.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I don’t have much experience dating, so I decided it would be good for me to, you know, get out there a little.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, good for you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And how many guys have you gone out with?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Please be less than two.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Three.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, the Swedes might beat us, but at least we won’t get gang-noogied in prison.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is Ernest Goes to Jail the only prison movie you’ve seen?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It scared me straight, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve been thinking. I was being petty. You can have my hewium.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you, Barry.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: But you have to add my name to your paper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s preposterous.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: I don’t know, seems fair. You can’t do it without me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can you give us a minute?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Take your time. I’ll walk out backwards for dwamatic effect.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t like being extorted like this. Especially by him of all people.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Me neither, but what other choice do we have?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I promise this is the last time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It says right here on Wikipedia. A Mexican standoff is a confrontation between at least three parties.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can you trust Wikipedia if they use between to refer to three parties?

utterance.speaker: Helium Man
utterance.content: They should’ve used among, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or amongst, if they were feeling whimsically archaic.

utterance.speaker: Helium Man
utterance.content: All right, enough with the chitchat. Are we gonna watch Ernest Goes to Jail or not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Absolutely. But don’t be surprised if this movie sets you on the straight and narrow.

utterance.speaker: Helium Man
utterance.content: I am open to change.
